reviews.body:
Thanks for this! See comments. :)

(Like we discussed offline, the `arp_responder` comments are an FYI for future work. :rocket:)

LGTM, ~but it would be nice to get to the bottom of what's going on [here](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/pull/1500#discussion_r400352242) if you have time. :)~

EDIT: [python 2 happened, we're good here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2609518/unboundlocalerror-with-nested-function-scopes)

@yxieca , can you review the document to see if any further information is needed?

> @yxieca , can you review the document to see if any further information is needed?

Probably add some information like:

- Is it safe to advertise same set of routes twice? (call test_announce_routes(fib) twice)
- If we want to advertise a new set of routes, how do we clear the existing routes?
- Example of adding/removing a single route.
@Pterosaur
@wangxin to review
@wangxin to review
@wangxin to review

@wangxin , I do not know if this is the best way to skip a test for a testbed. I do not like ptf32, ptf64, too many ptf, we should at least skip all ptf testbeds. maybe it is better to define a function to check the testbed type, only ptf, t0, t1. then, we can then filter the test based on testbed type.

second, i like the mark introduced in the pytest.ini, for example bsl. Then, we can use that mark to filter which test to run instead of using this skip.

for example, another requirement is to run all tests that allowed to run in t0 testbed. how do we specify that?
once you change to use regex then, i am good.

@wangxin to review. this is very similiar to this pr. https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/commit/ff2b1b12080bd51de14d9fe4ffe6250ec03d5cbb

I'll later spend time to cleanup all topology files. consolidate them. routing difference will be expressed in the fib.py fixture.

@prsunny, This is new test in pytest, so I marked it as new test.

@tahmed-dev: Since this issue is new, it appears this was caused by a behavior change in the csv.DictReader class. Can you confirm this? If so, please add some information about this to the PR description.

> @tahmed-dev: Since this issue is new, it appears this was caused by a behavior change in the csv.DictReader class. Can you confirm this? If so, please add some information about this to the PR description.

@jleveque: It looks like there was logic to handle commented lines in the current code base as could be seen here:
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/tests/conftest.py#L45

However the logic is flawed as it does continue with other keys, instead of skipping the whole line. It is not clear to me why we started seeing issues at the moment
LGTM. Will wait for other reviewers before approving.
@wangxin can you solve the merge conflicts?
@yxieca Sure
@wangxin can you resolve the merge conflict again? You can do "git rebase -i github/master" and then force push your branch to your fork. That way extra changes in master branch won't show.
@yxieca Thanks for the tip. Resolved conflicts.
Trying to toggle ports to recover before rebooting or config reloading is a good idea, I'll add this to sanity check in the future. Thanks!

latestReviews.body:
We should move on merging this PR first since it is not regressing anything.

However, I think there is a gap between ansible recovery and this pytest recovery method.

In ansible recovery, if there is a link down, we would first toggle port from both DUT side and the fanout side. (e.g. link flap test quit in the middle, leaving a fanout port down).

By only trying to recover from the DUT side, the above scenario would be missed.

But in any regards, this is a great improvement!

reviews.body:
We should move on merging this PR first since it is not regressing anything.

However, I think there is a gap between ansible recovery and this pytest recovery method.

In ansible recovery, if there is a link down, we would first toggle port from both DUT side and the fanout side. (e.g. link flap test quit in the middle, leaving a fanout port down).

By only trying to recover from the DUT side, the above scenario would be missed.

But in any regards, this is a great improvement!

comments.body: can you give command line how to use it when testing multi npu platforms?

@lguohan , the command is same as the one used currently for single NPU platforms, no new command-line arguments are added. I used the following command

py.test --inventory $INVT --host-pattern all --user admin --testbed $TB --testbed_file $TBFILE --junitxml=tr.xml test_bgp_fact.py
Can you upload a test result output too?

@yxieca, Please find the logs  below
[test_bgp_facts_results.zip](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/files/4278273/test_bgp_facts_results.zip)

Why didn't I find keyword 'num_npu' in the xml output? Should I expect to see it? Also, the filename is tr.xml.xml. Is that because you manually created this file? :-)
Hi Ying, my apologies  I uploaded the wrong results. I had renamed the file locally from tr.xml to test_bgp_facts.xml for clarity :)

[test_bgp_facts.zip](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/files/4283141/test_bgp_facts.zip)
